## Description {#details}

The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineconstantpool">MachineConstantPool</a> class keeps track of constants referenced by a function which must be spilled to memory.

This is used for constants which are unable to be used directly as operands to instructions, which typically include floating point and large integer constants.

Instructions reference the address of these constant pool constants through the use of MO&#95;ConstantPoolIndex values. When emitting assembly or machine code, these virtual address references are converted to refer to the address of the function constant pool values. The machine constant pool.

Definition at line 117 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineconstantpool-h">MachineConstantPool.h</a>.

### getConstantPoolIndex() {#afd6691ddb5d4adf50d744297e18a1c6d}

Create a new entry in the constant pool or return an existing one.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> must specify the minimum required alignment for the object.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> must specify the log2 of the minimum required alignment for the object.
